skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: DavidDworetzky

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no environment variable access. The skill references script concepts but contains no actual scripts.

content.value_statement: Users need guidance to build modular skills that extend Claude with specialized workflows and knowledge. This skill provides a structured 6-step process to create, test, and package reusable skills for any domain.
actual_capabilities: Provides a 6-step process for creating skills from concept to packaging
Defines skill anatomy including SKILL.md, scripts, references, and assets
Explains progressive disclosure design for efficient context management
Includes validation and packaging scripts for distribution
Guides iteration and improvement based on real-world usage
limitations: Does not execute code or create files directly
Does not access external APIs or services
Requires user to provide domain-specific content

use_cases.title: Package team knowledge
use_cases.description: Create skills that capture company policies, workflows, and domain expertise for consistent team responses.

use_cases.title: Build tool integrations
use_cases.description: Create skills with scripts and references for specialized development tasks like API integration or database operations.

use_cases.title: Customize Claude workflow
use_cases.description: Extend Claude with reusable assets and workflows for recurring tasks in their personal or professional work.

prompt_templates.title: Start new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill for Claude. I want to build a [SKILL-NAME] skill that [PURPOSE].

prompt_templates.title: Add resources
prompt_templates.prompt: What scripts, references, or assets should I include in my [SKILL-NAME] skill to support [USE-CASE]?

prompt_templates.title: Structure skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill plan: I want Claude to handle [TASK]. What should go in SKILL.md versus references files?

prompt_templates.title: Package skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Walk me through packaging my [SKILL-NAME] skill for distribution to other Claude users.

output_examples.input: Help me create a PDF editing skill for Claude
output: ‚úì Define skill purpose: Enable Claude to help users rotate, merge, and modify PDF documents
‚úì Structure SKILL.md with trigger conditions and usage examples

best_practices: Start with concrete examples of how the skill will be used before designing its structure
Use progressive disclosure to keep SKILL.md under 5k words while storing detailed reference material in references/
Validate and test skills with real tasks before packaging for distribution
anti_patterns: Including all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using references/ for detailed content
Creating skills without clear trigger conditions in the name and description
Skipping user testing and iteration after initial skill creation

faq.question: What tools support skills?
faq.answer: Skills work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool loads skills based on name and description matching.

faq.question: How large can a skill be?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 5k words. Bundled resources like scripts and references have no practical size limit.

faq.question: How do I integrate skills?
faq.answer: Place skills in the .claude/skills/ directory. Skills load automatically when their name or description matches user requests.

faq.question: Is my data safe in skills?
faq.answer: Skills only contain static documentation. They cannot access files, networks, or systems without explicit tool calls.

faq.question: Why is my skill not triggering?
faq.answer: Check that name and description clearly describe when to use the skill. Claude triggers skills based on relevance to user requests.

faq.question: How does this compare to other extensions?
faq.answer: Skills are lighter than MCP servers and more focused than system prompts. They provide reusable context without code execution.
